intro: Fumaria africana var. speciosa, commonly known as the African gloryflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are arranged in racemose inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed habitats.
